---
title: Summary
---

1.  [**Foundation in Mathematics and Statistics**](Topic1.qmd):

    -   Basic Probability Theory

    -   Descriptive Statistics (mean, median, mode, variance, standard deviation)

    -   Probability Distributions (normal, binomial, Poisson)

    -   Hypothesis Testing (t-tests, chi-square tests, ANOVA)

    -   Regression Analysis (linear regression, logistic regression)

2.  **Inferential Statistics**:

    -   Sampling Techniques (random sampling, stratified sampling)

    -   Confidence Intervals

    -   Hypothesis Testing (null hypothesis, p-values, Type I and Type II errors)

    -   Confidence Intervals vs. Hypothesis Testing

    -   Power Analysis

3.  **Machine Learning Fundamentals**:

    -   Introduction to Machine Learning

    -   Supervised Learning vs. Unsupervised Learning vs. Reinforcement Learning

    -   Model Evaluation and Selection (cross-validation, bias-variance tradeoff)

    -   Feature Engineering (feature selection, feature scaling)

    -   Model Evaluation Metrics (accuracy, precision, recall, F1 score, ROC curve, AUC)

4.  **Supervised Learning Algorithms**:

    -   Linear Regression

    -   Logistic Regression

    -   Decision Trees

    -   Random Forests

    -   Support Vector Machines (SVM)

    -   k-Nearest Neighbors (k-NN)

    -   Naive Bayes

5.  **Unsupervised Learning Algorithms**:

    -   K-Means Clustering

    -   Hierarchical Clustering

    -   Principal Component Analysis (PCA)

    -   t-Distributed Stochastic Neighbor Embedding (t-SNE)

    -   Association Rule Learning (Apriori Algorithm)

6.  **Deep Learning**:

    -   Neural Networks Basics

    -   Feedforward Neural Networks

    -   Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs)

    -   Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs)

    -   Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) Networks

    -   Gated Recurrent Units (GRUs)

7.  **Model Deployment and Production**:

    -   Model Deployment Techniques (RESTful APIs, Docker containers)

    -   Model Monitoring and Maintenance

    -   Ethical Considerations in Machine Learning

8.  **Practical Projects and Hands-On Experience**:

    -   Work on real-world datasets and projects to apply what you've learned.

    -   Kaggle competitions, online courses with practical exercises, and personal projects can all be valuable.
